1.text: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.

2.text: Keep my commandments and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.

3.text: Bind them upon thy fingers; write them upon the table of thine heart.

4.text: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:

5.text: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.

6.text: For at the window of my house I looked forth through my lattice;

7.text: And I beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,

8.text: Passing through the street near her corner, and he went the way to her house;

9.text: In the twilight, in the evening of the day, in the blackness of night and the darkness.

10.text: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and wily of heart.

11.text: She is clamorous, and wilful; her feet abide not in her house:

12.text: Now she is in the streets, now in the broad places, and lieth in wait at every corner.

13.text: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face she said unto him:

14.text: Sacrifices of peace offerings are with me; this day have I paid my vows.

15.text: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.

16.text: I have spread my couch with carpets of tapestry, with striped cloths of the yarn of Egypt.

17.text: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

18.text: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning; let us solace ourselves with loves.

19.text: For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:

20.text: He hath taken a bag of money with him; he will come home at the full moon.

21.text: With her much fair speech she causeth him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forceth him away.

22.text: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as fetters to the correction of the fool;

23.text: Till an arrow strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.

24.text: Now therefore, my sons, hearken unto me, and attend to the words of my mouth.

25.text: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.

26.text: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, all her slain are a mighty host.

27.text: Her house is the way to Sheol, going down to the chambers of death.
